Meaning: very dry or having no moisture
Example: He was parched after the long hike.

Meaning: corn crop
Example: Farmers can use large open lands to grow maize during the right season.

Meaning: very hot
Example: The searing sun made the workers look for some shade.

Meaning: dried up; something that has lost vitality or freshness
Example: The withered flowers have lost most of their nice color and scent.

Meaning: easily broken
Example: The branches were dry and brittle, so we easily broke them and started our campfire.

Meaning: to help grow or improve in some way
Example: The farmer works hard to nourish his crops and ensure a bountiful harvest.

Meaning: to operate or turn a handle or lever
Example: I am cranking the bicycle pedal by hand to make sure I fixed the chain correctly.

Meaning: to supply crops with water through a system of pipes, sprinklers, or streams
Example: The farmer irrigated the dry land so he could grow corn.

Meaning: metal that has become orange or reddish brown because it has been exposed to the air and water for a long period of time
Example: My grandfather's old car is very rusted after sitting outside for decades.

Meaning: damaged from over-use, to a point that it can no longer be used
Example: My sneakers are worn-out from running everyday.

Meaning: (n.) A smell or odor, especially a pleasant one.
Example: The aroma of hot buttered popcorn made our mouths water.

Meaning: (n.) A liquid used as a drink.
Example: When we ordered our beverages, I chose lemonade.

Meaning:
1. (adj.) Lacking a strong flavor.
2. (adj.) Not irritating, exciting, or disturbing.
(adj.) Easily broken; not flexible.

(n.) A number of similar things grouped together.
(v.) To gather or come together in a group.
(v.) To join or bring together

1. (v.) To use up.
2. (v.) To eat or drink.
3. (v.) To do away with or destroy.
(v.) To have a strong desire for

1. (v.) To prepare land for the growing of crops.
2. (v.) To grow or to help to grow.
3. (v.) To encourage development by attention or study.

(adj.) Equal to.
(n.) That which is equal to.

(v.) To send goods to another country for sale.
(n.) Something exported.

1. (v.) To remove or take out.
2. (v.) To obtain with an effort.
3. (n.) Something removed or taken out.

1. (v.) To cause to know; to make known by name.
2. (v.) To bring to the attention of, especially for the first time.
3. (v.) To bring into use.

(v.) To buy.
1. (n.) Something that is bought.
2. (n.) The act of buying.

1. (adj.) Of, from, or similar to the regions near the equator.
2. (adj.) Hot and moist.
